options.B: Variation in beak shape among finches

options.D: Variation in leaf shape in plants

options.B: Introduction of an invasive species for pest control
options.C: Clear-cutting of a forest for timber extraction

quiz.question: The term cell was given by

Most fishes do not sink in water because of the presences of: I. swim bladder II. air bladder III. air sacs IV. air in spongy bones

options.C: I, II, III and IV are correct

options.A: Hibernating during the hottest part of the day
options.B: Large scales on the back of a lizard
options.C: Feeding during the hottest part of the day
options.D: A small kidney to conserve water

What is autotrophic nutrition?

options.A: Nutrition in which organisms obtain food by breaking down complex organic compounds.
options.B: Nutrition in which organisms obtain food from other organisms
options.C: Nutrition in which organisms obtain food by consuming both plants and animals
options.D: Nutrition in which organisms produce their own food using energy from the sun or inorganic substances

quiz.question: The theory of evolution can be defined as

options.A: The belief that all species were created in their current form
options.B: The hypothesis that organisms strive to improve themselves over generations
options.C: The idea that species change over time through natural processes
options.D: The concept that evolution occurs through a series of sudden and dramatic changes

What is the definition of population ecology?

options.A: The study of interactions between organisms and their physical environment
options.B: The study of evolutionary processes and their effects on populations
options.C: The study of interactions between different populations in an ecosystem
options.D: The study of the distribution and abundance of individuals within a species

quiz.question: What is the term used to describe the maximum number of individuals of a species that an environment can support indefinitely?
Which of the following statements about the heart is true?

options.A: The heart is responsible for the production of red blood cells
options.B: The heart pumps oxygenated blood to the lungs
options.C: The heart receives blood from the kidneys and filters waste products
options.D: The heart is a muscular organ that contracts to circulate blood throughout the body
